'''Taylor Warf''' (born March 22, 1991), better known as '''Lil Warf''' or '''Colton Harris- Moore''' in his home town, is an 18-year-old [[fugitive]] from [[Camano Island, Washington|Camano Island]], [[Washington]]. He is suspected in the theft of at least three small aircraft, a boat, and a car,<ref name=holtz-09-dec /> and in the burglaries of at least 50 private residences in various locations around the [[Pacific Northwest]] of the United States and Canada.<ref name=stevick /><ref name=katu /><ref>{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=America's Most Wanted Teen-Aged Bandit |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1946950,00.html |quote=Colton Harris-Moore, a gangly 18-year-old with furtive eyes and a dimpled chin, has been on police blotters since he was accused of stealing a bike at the age of 8. Since then, he is suspected of having committed nearly 100 burglaries in Washington, Idaho and Canada. Police allege that he graduated from bikes to cars, then to speedboats. Lately, he is suspected of stealing three small aircraft â all the more impressive given that he has never taken a single flying lesson. ...|work=[[Time magazine]] |date=December 21, 2009 |accessdate=2009-12-14 }}</ref>
+
'''Colton Harris-Moore''' (born March 22, 1991), better known as '''Colt''' in his home town, is an 18-year-old [[fugitive]] from [[Camano Island, Washington|Camano Island]], [[Washington]]. He is suspected in the theft of at least three small aircraft, a boat, and a car,<ref name=holtz-09-dec /> and in the burglaries of at least 50 private residences in various locations around the [[Pacific Northwest]] of the United States and Canada.<ref name=stevick /><ref name=katu /><ref>{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=America's Most Wanted Teen-Aged Bandit |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1946950,00.html |quote=Colton Harris-Moore, a gangly 18-year-old with furtive eyes and a dimpled chin, has been on police blotters since he was accused of stealing a bike at the age of 8. Since then, he is suspected of having committed nearly 100 burglaries in Washington, Idaho and Canada. Police allege that he graduated from bikes to cars, then to speedboats. Lately, he is suspected of stealing three small aircraft â all the more impressive given that he has never taken a single flying lesson. ...|work=[[Time magazine]] |date=December 21, 2009 |accessdate=2009-12-14 }}</ref>
Because he has been observed running from the police [[barefoot]] (perhaps to conceal his footprints) he has been dubbed "the Barefoot Burglar". He is 6 feet and 5 inches tall.
Because he has been observed running from the police [[barefoot]] (perhaps to conceal his footprints) he has been dubbed "the Barefoot Burglar". He is 6 feet and 5 inches tall.
â
Taylor Warf grew up in his mother's house in the Stanwood-Camano School District.<ref name=brooks-feb07 /> Neighbors said they made several calls to Child Protective Services, believing Taylor was neglected or abused.<ref name=brooks-feb07 /> Warf was in and out of trouble since pre-adolescence, and police found a neighbor's camcorder in his home in 2003. Never before sentenced to more than a month,<ref name=brooks-feb07 /> Harris-Moore fled a 3-year sentence by walking out of a halfway house in April 2008.<ref name=stevick />
+
== Biography ==
  +
Colton Harris-Moore grew up in his mother's house in the Stanwood-Camano School District.<ref name=brooks-feb07 /> Neighbors said they made several calls to Child Protective Services, believing Colton was neglected or abused.<ref name=brooks-feb07 /> Colton was in and out of trouble since pre-adolescence, and police found a neighbor's camcorder in his home in 2003. Never before sentenced to more than a month,<ref name=brooks-feb07 /> Harris-Moore fled a 3-year sentence by walking out of a halfway house in April 2008.<ref name=stevick />
â
Taylor's mother, Nicole Hill, has said that her son's father left when he was about 2, his stepfather died when he was about 7, and from the time Taylor was in the first grade, she knew there was something off about himâa "sort of a disconnection." He wouldn't listen to his teachers, started altercations at school, and sometimes deliberately broke things around the house, Hill said.<ref name=katu />
+
Colton's mother, Pam Kohler, has said that her son's father left when he was about 2, his stepfather died when he was about 7, and from the time Colton was in the first grade, she knew there was something off about himâa "sort of a disconnection." He wouldn't listen to his teachers, started altercations at school, and sometimes deliberately broke things around the house, Kohler said.<ref name=katu />
He attended [[Stanwood High School]] up to the end of his sophomore year.
He attended [[Stanwood High School]] up to the end of his sophomore year.
==Suspected offenses==
==Suspected offenses==
â
In addition to numerous burglaries,Taylor has allegedly stolen three airplanes by hot-wiring them and then crash-landing them. He once went to a house to have a shower and stole ice cream from the refrigerator, and has also used a computer and stolen credit card in a house to purchase a pair of [[night vision goggles]], among other things, on the internet. After his numerous escapes from police, he left a note to the police declaring "war" on them and broke into a police car and stole a rifle. Therefore, he is now considered armed and dangerous.
+
In addition to numerous burglaries, Colton has allegedly stolen three airplanes by hot-wiring them and then crash-landing them. He once went to a house to have a shower and stole ice cream from the refrigerator, and has also used a computer and stolen credit card in a house to purchase a pair of [[night vision goggles]], among other things, on the internet. After his numerous escapes from police, he left a note to the police declaring "war" on them and broke into a police car and stole a rifle. Therefore, he is now considered armed and dangerous.
